intro: Macairea rosea, commonly known as the pink macairea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
